required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Nivolumab Safety and Pharmacokinetics in Patients With Severe Sepsis or Septic Shock.
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel Group Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of BMS-936558 (Nivolumab) in Participants With Severe Sepsis or Septic Shock.

brief_summary.textblock: A study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of Nivolumab in participants with severe sepsis or septic shock.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Incidence Rates of Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Adverse Events (AEs), Immune-mediated AEs, AEs Leading to Discontinuation, and Deaths
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, day -1, day 1 and subsequent days after, up to 90 days

primary_outcome.measure: Composite of Vital Signs and Electrocardiogram (ECG)
primary_outcome.description: Includes body temperature, respiratory rate, blood pressure and heart rate. Blood pressure and heart rate should be measured after the participant has been resting quietly for at least 5 minutes.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and subsequent days after, up to 90 days
Day 1 and subsequent days after, up to 90 days

primary_outcome.description: Area under the serum concentration-time curve from time zero to time of last quantifiable concentration

primary_outcome.description: Total clearance of serum concentration of nivolumab

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and subsequent days after, up to 90 days
primary_outcome.description: Half-Life of nivolumab derived from serum concentration

secondary_outcome.description: Receptor occupancy on T cells at baseline and after study treatment administration at planned sampling time points

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Detectable Anti-nivolumab Antibodies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and subsequent days after, up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Participant with positive anti-drug antibody detection

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Any Detectable Anti-drug Antibodies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and subsequent days after, up to 90 days

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding Bristol-Myers Squibb Clinical Trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women ages â‰¥ 18 years old
- Documented or suspected infection
- Severe sepsis or septic shock for at least 24 hours
- Sepsis-induced immunosuppression
- In Intensive Care Unit (ICU) with no plans to discharge in next 24 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous episode of severe sepsis or septic shock with ICU admission during the current hospitalization
- Autoimmune disease
- Organ or bone marrow transplant
- Cancer treatment in the past 6 weeks
- Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection and not on therapy prior to this episode of sepsis; hepatitis C virus(HCV) infection and still has virus (not cured); Chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection and not on treatment
Other protocol defined inclusion/exclusion criteria could apply

facility.name: Pulmonary And Critical Care Of Atlanta
University of Michigan, Division of Acute Care Surgery

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 38 subjects were enrolled in the study. 31 were randomized; 7 not randomized: (5) Failed to meet study eligibility criteria, (1) died, (1) withdrew consent

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period â‰¤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
